Question
========
  
A pharmaceutical company has developed a new drug against migraine and wants to test its efficacy with a sample of migraineurs. Since the drug has some known side effects, the company wants as much certainty as possible as to whether the drug actually helps against migraine. How can the company best accomplish this?

  
Answerlist
----------
* By the usual significance level $\alpha$ = 5% to reduce to $\alpha$ = 1%.
* Due to the usual significance level $\alpha$ = 5% to increase to $\alpha$ = 10%.  
* By choosing a 99% confidence interval.
* By choosing a 90% confidence interval.
